question.text: Which of the following statement is incorrect?

options.text: Most of the euglenoids live in running fresh water while Dinoflagellates are mostly marine.
Euglenoids carry same pigments as that of higher plants
Amoeboid protozoans live in fresh water, sea water or moist soil
Marine amoeboids have silica shells on their surface

solution.text: Euglenoids are members of the kingdom Protista. They live in stagnant freshwater. They show mixotrophic nutrition i.e. autotrophic as well as heterotrophic nutrition. In the presence of sunlight, they are autotrophic (having photosynthetic pigments similar to higher plants) while in absence of sunlight they are heterotrophic and show predation. Dinoflagellates are mostly marine members.
